Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, I should probably go through each case and calculate the total time taken to resolve the ticket. That way, I can see which ones are significantly slower.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: The total resolution time would be the time between when the ticket was received and when it was closed. So for each Case ID, I need to find the first and last events, get their timestamps, and subtract them to find the duration.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Total average per case is (2.25 + 21.25 + 1.33 + 23.83 + 50.42) / 5 = Let's compute: ... Average per case: 99.08 / 5 = 19.816 hours, which is about 19.8 hours or 19 hours 48 minutes.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So, significantly longer cases are those where the time is more than, say, 40% above average or more. Let's see: ... Case 105: ~50.42 hours - that's way above, over 2 days.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with Case 102. Case 102: ... So, it took until the next day to resolve. The escalation happened at 11:30, but the investigation didn't start until 14:00, which is 2.5 hours later.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In Case 104: ... Here, the ticket was assigned but took until the next day to resolve. The investigate step happened at 13:00, but resolution was the next morning at 08:00. That's a long waitâ€”over 19 hours.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In Case 105: ... This one is interesting because it was escalated, but then there's another investigate event. So, it took two days after escalation to resolve.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Looking for common factors: - Escalation happened in Cases 102 and 105. Maybe the specialized team is slow. - Long waiting times between activities, especially between escalate and investigate, and between investigate and resolution.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Potential root causes: 1. Delays after escalation: The Level-2 team may not be responding promptly. 2. Prolonged investigative steps without timely follow-up. 3. Inconsistent or delayed resolution after investigation.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Recommendations could include: - Monitoring escalations more closely and providing incentives or penalties for Level-2 teams to respond timely. - Reviewing the investigative process to ensure that once started, it doesn't have unnecessary delays.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Alternatively, maybe there's a dependency on external teams or systems that are causing delays, which can be identified through further root cause analysis.
